types.name: Action
types.description: Represents an executable action in the system.

fields.name: collections
fields.description: Collections to which this action belongs.

fields.name: definedAt
fields.description: Timestamp when the action was defined.

fields.name: hash
fields.description: Unique hash identifying the action definition.

fields.name: implementations
fields.description: List of implementations for this action.

fields.name: isDev
fields.description: Marks whether the action is in development.

fields.name: isTestFor
fields.description: Actions for which this is a test.

fields.name: kind
fields.description: The kind or category of the action.

fields.name: pinned
fields.description: Check if the current user has pinned this action.

fields.name: portGroups
fields.description: Port groups used in the action for organizing ports.

fields.name: returns
fields.description: Output values (ports) returned by the action.

fields.name: runs
fields.description: Retrieve assignations where this action has run.

fields.name: scope
fields.description: Scope of the action, e.g., user or system.

fields.name: stateful
fields.description: Indicates whether the action maintains state.

fields.name: tests
fields.description: List of tests associated with the action.

types.name: ActionDemand
types.description: Input model for action demand.

types.name: ActionDemandInput
types.description: The input for creating a action demand.

inputFields.name: argMatches
inputFields.description: The demands for the action args and returns. This is used to identify the demand in the system.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The description of the action. This can described the action and its purpose.

inputFields.name: forceArgLength
inputFields.description: Require that the action has a specific number of args. This is used to identify the demand in the system.

inputFields.name: forceReturnLength
inputFields.description: Require that the action has a specific number of returns. This is used to identify the demand in the system.

inputFields.name: hash
inputFields.description: The hash of the action. This is used to identify the action in the system.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: The key of the action. This is used to identify the action in the system.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the action. This is used to identify the action in the system.

inputFields.name: protocols
inputFields.description: The protocols that the action has to implement. This is used to identify the demand in the system.

inputFields.name: returnMatches
inputFields.description: The demands for the action args and returns. This is used to identify the demand in the system.

types.name: ActionHash
types.description: The `ArrayLike` scalar type represents a reference to a store previously created by the user n a datalayer

types.name: ActionKind
types.description: The kind of action.

types.name: Agent
types.description: Represents a compute agent that can execute implementations.

fields.name: active
fields.description: Determine if the agent is currently active based on last seen timestamp.

fields.name: fileSystemShelves
fields.description: Filesystem shelves available on the agent.

fields.name: implementation
fields.description: Fetch a specific implementation by interface.

fields.name: instanceId
fields.description: Unique instance identifier on the agent.

fields.name: lastSeen
fields.description: Last timestamp this agent was seen.

fields.name: latestHardwareRecord
fields.description: Retrieve the latest hardware record for this agent.

fields.name: pinned
fields.description: Check if this agent is pinned by the current user.

fields.name: registry
fields.description: Registry entry this agent belongs to.

fields.name: states
fields.description: Current and historical states associated with the agent.

types.name: AgentFilter
types.description: A way to filter agents

inputFields.name: clientId
inputFields.description: Filter by client ID of the app the agent is registered to

inputFields.name: extensions
inputFields.description: Filter by extensions of the agents

inputFields.name: hasImplementations
inputFields.description: Filter by implementations of the agents

inputFields.name: hasStates
inputFields.description: Filter by states of the agents

inputFields.name: ids
inputFields.description: Filter by IDs of the agents

inputFields.name: instanceId
inputFields.description: Filter by instance ID of the agent

inputFields.name: pinned
inputFields.description: Filter by pinned agents

inputFields.name: search
inputFields.description: Filter by name of the agents

inputFields.name: extensions
inputFields.description: The extensions of the agent. This is used to identify the agent in the system.

inputFields.name: instanceId
inputFields.description: The instance ID of the agent. This is used to identify the agent in the system.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the agent. This is used to identify the agent in the system.

types.name: AnyDefault
types.description: The `ArrayLike` scalar type represents a reference to a store previously created by the user n a datalayer

types.name: ArchiveStateInput
types.description: The input for archiving a state schema.

types.name: Args
types.description: The `Args` scalar type represents a Dictionary of arguments

types.name: AssignInput

inputFields.name: asParagraph
inputFields.description: Whether to display the input as a paragraph or not. This is used for text inputs and dropdowns

fields.name: arg
fields.description: Get a specific argument by key.

fields.name: ephemeral

fields.name: events
fields.description: List of recent events for this assignation.

fields.name: instructs

fields.name: isDone
fields.description: Indicates if the assignation is completed.

fields.name: parent

fields.name: root

fields.description: Optional message associated with the event.

types.description: The event kind of the assignationevent

types.name: AssignationInstruct

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID of the instruct event.

types.name: AssignationInstructKind
types.description: The event kind of the assignationevent

fields.name: actionDemands
fields.description: Get the actions that this blok can run.

fields.name: materializedBloks
fields.description: Materialized bloks that are instances of this blok.

fields.name: possibleAgents
fields.description: Get the agents that this blok can be implemented against.

fields.name: stateDemands
fields.description: Get the actions that this blok can run.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: CancelInput
types.description: The input for canceling an assignation.

types.name: ChoiceInput
types.description:
A choice is a value that can be selected in a dropdown.

It is composed of a value, a label, and a description. The value is the
value that is returned when the choice is selected. The label is the
text that is displayed in the dropdown. The description is the text
that is displayed when the user hovers over the choice.

types.name: Client
types.description: Represents a registered OAuth2 client.

types.name: ClientFilter
types.description: A way to filter apps

types.name: ClientOrder
types.description: A way to order apps

types.name: CollectInput
types.description: The input for collecting a shelved item in a drawer.

types.name: Collection
types.description: A grouping of actions.

types.name: CreateBlokInput
types.description: The input for creating a blok.

inputFields.name: actionDemands
inputFields.description: The action demands of the blok. This is used to identify the blok in the system.

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The description of the blok. This can described the blok and its purpose.

inputFields.name: stateDemands
inputFields.description: The state demands of the blok. This is used to identify the blok in the system.

inputFields.name: url
inputFields.description: The URL of the blok. This can be used to link to the blok in the system.

types.name: CreateDashboardInput
types.description: The input for creating a dashboard.

types.name: CreateForeignImplementationInput
types.description: The input for creating a implementation in another agents extension.

inputFields.name: agent
inputFields.description: The agent ID to create the implementation in. This is used to identify the agent in the system.

types.name: CreateImplementationInput
types.description: The input for creating a implementation.

types.name: CreateShortcutInput
types.description: The input for creating a shortcut.

inputFields.name: toolbox
inputFields.description: The toolbox ID to create the shortcut in. If not provided, the shortcut will be created in the default toolbox.

types.name: CreateStateSchemaInput
types.description: The input for creating a state schema.

types.name: CreateToolboxInput
types.description: The input for creating a toolbox.

types.name: DateTime
types.description: Date with time (isoformat)

types.name: DefinitionInput
types.description:
A definition

    Definitions are the building implementation for Actions and provide the
    information needed to create a action. They are primarly composed of a name,
    a description, and a list of ports.

    Definitions provide a protocol of input and output, and do not contain
    any information about the actual implementation of the action ( this is handled
    by a implementation that implements a action).

inputFields.name: args
inputFields.description: The args of the definition. This is the input ports of the definition

inputFields.name: collections
inputFields.description: The collections of the definition. This is used to group definitions together in the UI

inputFields.name: description
inputFields.description: The description of the definition. This is the text that is displayed in the UI

inputFields.name: interfaces
inputFields.description: The interfaces of the definition. This is used to group definitions together in the UI

inputFields.name: isDev
inputFields.description: Whether the definition is a dev definition or not. If the definition is a dev definition, it can be used to create a dev action. If the definition is not a dev definition, it cannot be used to create a dev action

inputFields.name: isTestFor
inputFields.description: The tests for the definition. This is used to group definitions together in the UI

inputFields.name: kind
inputFields.description: The kind of the definition. This is the type of the definition. Can be either a function or a generator

inputFields.name: logo
inputFields.description: The logo of the definition. This is used to display the logo in the UI

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: The name of the actions. This is used to uniquely identify the definition

inputFields.name: portGroups
inputFields.description: The port groups of the definition. This is used to group ports together in the UI

inputFields.name: returns
inputFields.description: The returns of the definition. This is the output ports of the definition

inputFields.name: stateful
inputFields.description: Whether the definition is stateful or not. If the definition is stateful, it can be used to create a stateful action. If the definition is not stateful, it cannot be used to create a stateful action

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the agent to delete. This is used to identify the agent in the system.

types.name: DeleteImplementationInput
types.description: The input for deleting a implementation.

types.name: DeleteShortcutInput
types.description: The input for deleting a shortcut.

types.name: Dependency
types.description: Represents a dependency between implementations and actions.

fields.name: action
fields.description: Optional action this dependency refers to.

fields.name: binds
fields.description: Binds information attached to the dependency.

fields.name: initialHash
fields.description: Original hash when the dependency was created.

fields.name: optional
fields.description: Indicates if the dependency is optional.

fields.name: reference
fields.description: Optional string identifier or tag for reference.

fields.name: resolvable
fields.description: Check if this dependency can be resolved by a connected agent.

types.name: DependencyInput
types.description:
A dependency for a implementation. By defining dependencies, you can
    create a dependency graph for your implementations and actions

types.name: EffectInput
types.description:
An effect is a way to modify a port based on a condition. For example,
    you could have an effect that sets a port to null if another port is null.

    Or, you could have an effect that hides the port if another port meets a condition.
    E.g when the user selects a certain option in a dropdown, another port is hidden.

types.name: EffectKind
types.description: The kind of effect.

types.name: FileDrawer
types.description: Represents a file-based drawer within a filesystem shelve.

types.name: FileDrawerFilter
types.description: A way to filter shelved items

types.name: FilesystemShelve
types.description: Shelve on an agent for filesystem-based resources.

fields.name: drawers
fields.description: List of file drawers in the shelve.

types.name: FilesystemShelveFilter
types.description: A way to filter shelved items

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: HardwareRecord
types.description: Represents a record of an agent's hardware configuration.

fields.name: agent
fields.description: The agent to which this hardware belongs.

fields.name: cpuFrequency
fields.description: Clock speed of the CPU in GHz.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Timestamp when this record was created.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID of the hardware record.

types.name: HookInput
types.description: A hook is a function that is called when a action has reached a specific lifecycle point. Hooks are jsut actions that take an assignation as input and return a value.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Identifier
types.description: The `ArrayLike` scalar type represents a reference to a store previously created by the user n a datalayer

types.name: Implementation
types.description: Represents a concrete implementation of an action.

fields.name: interface
fields.description: Interface string representing the implementation entrypoint.

fields.name: myLatestAssignation
fields.description: Get the latest completed assignation created by the current user.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Constructed name for display, combining interface and agent name.

fields.name: pinned
fields.description: Check if this implementation is pinned by the current user.

types.name: ImplementationInput
types.description: A implementation is a blueprint for a action. It is composed of a definition, a list of dependencies, and a list of params.

types.name: InstanceId
types.description: The `ArrayLike` scalar type represents a reference to a store previously created by the user n a datalayer

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.description: The input for interrupting an assignation.

fields.name: actionMappings
fields.description: Mappings of actions to this materialized blok.

fields.name: stateMappings
fields.description: Mappings of states to this materialized blok.

fields.name: label
fields.description: Get the latest value stored in this drawer.

types.name: PortDemandInput
types.description: The input for creating a port demand.

inputFields.name: forceLength
inputFields.description: Require that the action has a specific number of ports. This is used to identify the demand in the system.

inputFields.name: forceNonNullableLength
inputFields.description: Require that the action has a specific number of non-nullable ports. This is used to identify the demand in the system.

inputFields.name: forceStructureLength
inputFields.description: Require that the action has a specific number of structure ports. This is used to identify the demand in the system.

inputFields.name: kind
inputFields.description: The kind of the demand. You can ask for args or returns

inputFields.name: matches
inputFields.description: The matches of the demand.

types.name: PortGroupInput
types.description: A Port Group is a group of ports that are related to each other. It is used to group ports together in the UI and provide a better user experience.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: The key of the port group. This is used to uniquely identify the port group

types.name: PortInput
types.description:
Port

    A Port is a single input or output of a action. It is composed of a key and a kind
    which are used to uniquely identify the port.

    If the Port is a structure, we need to define a identifier and scope,
    Identifiers uniquely identify a specific type of model for the scopes (e.g
    all the ports that have the identifier "@mikro/image" are of the same type, and
    are hence compatible with each other). Scopes are used to define in which context
    the identifier is valid (e.g. a port with the identifier "@mikro/image" and the
    scope "local", can only be wired to other ports that have the same identifier and
    are running in the same app). Global ports are ports that have the scope "global",
    and can be wired to any other port that has the same identifier, as there exists a
    mechanism to resolve and retrieve the object for each app. Please check the rekuest
    documentation for more information on how this works.

types.name: PortKind
types.description: The kind of port.

types.name: PortMatch
types.description: Port matching in action demands.

types.name: PortMatchInput
types.description: The input for creating a port match.

inputFields.name: at
inputFields.description: The index of the port to match.

inputFields.name: children
inputFields.description: The matches for the children of the port to match.

inputFields.name: identifier
inputFields.description: The identifier of the port to match.

inputFields.name: key
inputFields.description: The key of the port to match.

inputFields.name: kind
inputFields.description: The kind of the port to match.

inputFields.name: nullable
inputFields.description: Whether the port is nullable.

types.name: Protocol
types.description: A set of related actions forming a protocol.

fields.name: myImplementationAt
fields.description: Find your implementation at a specific interface.

fields.name: myreservations
fields.description: Reservations made by the current user.

types.description: Reservation for planned assignment of implementations.

types.description: A way to filter reservations

types.name: ReservationStrategy
types.description: The pattern of assignment of the reservation

types.name: ReserveInput
types.description: The input for reserving a action.

types.name: ResumeInput

types.name: ReturnWidgetInput
types.description:
A Return Widget is a UI element that is used to display the value of a port.

    Return Widgets get displayed both if we show the return values of an assignment,
    but also when we inspect the given arguments of a previous run task. Their primary
    usecase is to adequately display the value of a port, in a user readable way.

    Return Widgets are often overwriten by the underlying UI framework (e.g. Orkestrator)
    to provide a better user experience. For example, a return widget that displays a
    date could be overwriten to display a calendar widget.

    Return Widgets provide more a way to customize this overwriten behavior.

types.name: ReturnWidgetKind
types.description: The kind of return widget.

types.description: The input for creating a action demand.

inputFields.description: The hash of the state.

inputFields.description: The demands for the action args and returns. This is used to identify the demand in the system.

inputFields.name: protocols
inputFields.description: The protocols that the action has to implement. This is used to identify the demand in the system.

types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

fields.name: implementations

fields.name: newActions

fields.name: stateUpdateEvents
fields.description: Subscribe to updates of state values and patches.

fields.description: If true, measures performance rather than correctness.

fields.name: name

fields.name: results

types.name: User

types.name: ValidatorFunction
types.description:
The `Validator` scalar represents a javascript function that should execute on the client side (inside a shadow realm)
      to validate a value (or a set of values) before it is sent to the server.  The function has two parameters (value, otherValues) and should return a string if the value is invalid and undefined if the value is valid.
        The otherValues parameter is an object with the other values in the form {fieldName: value}.

types.name: ValidatorInput
types.description:
A validating function for a port. Can specify a function that will run when validating values of the port.
If outside dependencies are needed they need to be specified in the dependencies field. With the .. syntax
when transversing the tree of ports.

types.name: Waiter
types.description: Entity that waits for the completion of assignations.

fields.name: instanceId
fields.description: Instance ID associated with the waiter.

types.name: WaiterFilter
types.description: A way to filter waiters

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
